outline:
1. to rest
    1. (Qal)
      1. to rest, settle down and remain
      2. to repose, have rest, be quiet
    2. (Hiph)
      1. to cause to rest, give rest to, make quiet
      2. to cause to rest, cause to alight, set down
      3. to lay or set down, deposit, let lie, place
      4. to let remain, leave
      5. to leave, depart from
      6. to abandon
      7. to permit
    3. (Hoph)
      1. to obtain rest, be granted rest
      2. to be left, be placed
      3. open space (subst)
kjv_def: cease, be confederate, lay, let down, (be) quiet, remain, (cause to, be at, give, have, make to) rest, set down. Compare H3241 (יָנִים).
strongs_def: to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)
